summary: Benign tumors are abnormal growths in the body that are not cancerous. They grow only in one place and cannot spread or invade other parts of the body. However, they can be dangerous if they press on vital organs. Tumors are made up of extra cells that divide without stopping.
causes: Cells grow old and die, and new cells take their place. Sometimes, this process goes wrong. New cells form when your body does not need them, and old cells do not die when they should.
subtypes: Recurrent Respiratory Papillomatosis or Laryngeal Papillomatosis
